qas.question: Socioeconomic factors and enduring views on race has led to what for certain racial groups?
What is discrimination often paired with?
What do members of one group typically perceive the moral standing of outgroups as?
What do groups with less power often find themselves?
What has led to many tragic instances of events like slavery and genocide?

context: Socioeconomic factors, in combination with early but enduring views of race, have led to <a0_0>considerable suffering<a0_0/> within disadvantaged racial groups. Racial discrimination often coincides with <a1_0>racist mindsets<a1_0/>, whereby the individuals and ideologies of one group come to perceive the members of an outgroup as both racially defined and morally <a2_0>inferior<a2_0/>. As a result, racial groups possessing relatively little power often find themselves <a3_0>excluded or oppressed<a3_0/>, while hegemonic individuals and institutions are charged with holding racist attitudes. <a4_0>Racism<a4_0/> has led to many instances of tragedy, including slavery and genocide.
